assignment_info.name: a4v1
assignment_info.title: Assignment 4 - Data Transformation Part 2 (Mutate, Summarize, Group_by)
assignment_info.description: Advanced data transformation using mutate(), summarize(), group_by(), and count() for business analytics

technical_execution.description: Code quality, syntax, execution, and proper use of advanced dplyr functions
criteria: All code cells executed with visible outputs
Proper use of pipe operator (%>%) throughout
Correct syntax for mutate(), summarize(), group_by(), count()
No errors or warnings that affect results
Proper use of case_when() and ifelse() for categorical variables

deductions.no_outputs: Code without outputs = 0 points for that section
deductions.wrong_functions: Using base R instead of dplyr = 15% deduction

data_analysis.description: Correct implementation of data transformation operations - MOST IMPORTANT

part2_mutate_financial.description: Create 6 financial metrics (Profit, Profit_Margin, Cost_Ratio, Revenue_Per_Unit, Cost_Per_Unit, ROI)

part3_categorical.description: Create 5 categorical variables (Performance_Category, Revenue_Size, Deal_Size, High_Value_Customer, Profitable_Deal)

part5_group_by.description: Grouped analysis (Regional, Product Category, Performance Category)

scoring_rules.section_complete: Working code + visible output = full points
scoring_rules.section_partial: Code without output = 50% of section points
scoring_rules.section_incomplete: No code or template only = 0 points

business_thinking.description: Understanding of business applications and advanced data transformation concepts

financial_metrics.description: Understanding of profit margins, ROI, and efficiency metrics
financial_metrics.excellent: Correctly calculates all 6 metrics with proper formulas
financial_metrics.poor: Fewer than 3 metrics or major errors

segmentation.description: Proper use of categorical variables for business segmentation
segmentation.excellent: All 5 categories created with correct thresholds and logic
segmentation.poor: Fewer than 3 categories or incorrect logic

grouped_analysis.description: Meaningful grouped analysis across business dimensions
grouped_analysis.excellent: All 3+ groupings with revenue_share and proper sorting

insights.description: Business intelligence dashboard shows understanding of KPIs
insights.excellent: Comprehensive dashboard with formatted output and insights

communication.description: Code comments, output clarity, and overall presentation
criteria: Code is well-commented explaining business logic
Outputs are clearly labeled and formatted
Results are interpreted with business context
Dashboard output is formatted and readable

scoring_guide.excellent: All criteria met, professional business presentation

detection_rules.description: Student code must be at least 130% of template length

output_verification.description: CRITICAL: If code has visible output, section is COMPLETE
output_verification.action: Do NOT mark as incomplete if output is present
examples: Code: company_data %>% mutate(...) + Output showing new columns = COMPLETE
Code: summarize(...) + Output showing summary = COMPLETE

minimum_completion.description: Must complete at least 50% of sections for passing grade

mutate_requirement.description: Must create at least 10 new variables using mutate()
mutate_requirement.action: If < 10 variables, deduct 20% from data_analysis score

group_by_requirement.description: Must perform at least 3 different group_by analyses
group_by_requirement.action: If < 3 groupings, deduct 25% from data_analysis score

output_requirement.description: Code without outputs counts as incomplete
output_requirement.action: Sections without outputs = 0 points for that section

template_submission.feedback: This submission appears to be primarily template code with minimal student work.

incomplete_execution.feedback: Code must be executed to show outputs. Unexecuted code receives partial credit.

missing_groupings.feedback: Must perform grouped analysis by Region, Product_Category, and Performance_Category.

grading_instructions.step_1: Check if tidyverse is loaded and company_sales_data.csv is imported
grading_instructions.step_2: Count new variables created with mutate() - should be 10+ (6 financial + 5 categorical)
grading_instructions.step_3: Verify summarize() operations calculate correct business metrics
grading_instructions.step_4: Count group_by() analyses - should be 3+ (Region, Product_Category, Performance_Category)
grading_instructions.step_5: Check for count() usage and cross-tabulation
